In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?

Basically India is a developing country. Since it is a developing country there is an  enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand when we compare with the developed countries.

The following are the reasons why the people in India are facing Health care  problems:

  •  Since India is a developing country and consists of large population and most of the population is below poverty line they don't have proper food because of that  reason they fall under mal nutrition category.
  • The 70% population below poverty line who are surviving in india are  having one  day meal.
  • Pvt.Medical services are very costly in the present situation which are not affordable by the poor and middle class people.
  • Government medical services are not up to the mark.
  • One of the major reason in India  is most of the population is uneducated ,unemployment and lack of information.
  • Since most of the population is from urban areas and are uneducated people they don't have complete information about the health care supply units.
  • The unempolyment problem play a vital role along with the poverty.
  • There a high increse in the inflation rate.The people below the povery line and common man are not in a position to buy anything to survive.
  • Due to increase in the cost of goods the common man can't puchase any thing for their family especially food which leads to the deficiency in the children and youth.
  • When we compare the health care facilities of a developed country with our country we are lagging in this sector.

The following are the major steps should be taken by the Government to improve patient care in the country:

  •  The first and foremost step is to provide 100% free medical service to all people who are below poverty line.
  • The Government should implement new technolgy from the developed countries which helps to  save the life's of many people.
  • The Government should improve and encourage in Research and development (R&D) especially in medical sector.
  • The Government should provide guidelines and services provided by them  especially to the urban and rural population by awareness programs.
  • Since most of the population in India are uneducated.By using new technology like Television spread the awareness of health camps and services provided by the Government.
  • The Government should take care in not only providing the health services but also remedial steps should be explained  clearly to the patient.
  • The Government should provide free medicine's required to the patient along with service
  • The Government should provide 24/7 ambulance service.
  • The Government should pay attention towards the people who are below poverty line and take care of their food,education and medical care.
  • when the proper education along with the food is provided to the children they will not fall ill, we will have healthy and happy Indian population.
